items.title: only set content type on not modified file loads
Fix warning about deprecated '.mozilla' certsConfig
items.body: The fix is doing what the compiler warning wants: it replaces `.mozilla` with `.openbsd`

items.title: Enable nonblocking operation
items.body:
This PR is part of a series to enable nonblocking operation in Vapor and solve https://github.com/vapor/engine/issues/66

This PR depends on https://github.com/vapor/engine/pull/71

items.title: Add support for overwriting slugName in resource
items.body: This is related to the issue #691 and the solution I came up with with a little experimentation.  I don't see this as the final draft or the best solution but figured a PR would be the best place to get some feedback so others could benefit.

items.title: Fix a crash where parsing a Multipart with empty content
items.body:
Reported in Slack, a crash when parsing this body:

```
------WebKitFormBoundaryUIJNcsyK0GGA6kOU
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="xib"; filename=""
Content-Type: application/octet-stream


------WebKitFormBoundaryUIJNcsyK0GGA6kOU
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="ajax"

1
------WebKitFormBoundaryUIJNcsyK0GGA6kOU
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="xib"; filename="AlarmSettings.xib"
Content-Type: application/octet-stream

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?>
....SNIP...
------WebKitFormBoundaryUIJNcsyK0GGA6kOU———
```

The crash was caused by the first part, which was created by an HTML `file` input which had been left empty. Vapor crashed on line 45 of Vapor/Utilities/Byte/Data.swift trying to make a range where the lower bound was greater than the upper bound.

I've simply put in a conditional that stops that from happening, and causes an empty part to be ignored. There may be a better solution but this stops the crash.

items.title: Expose mediaTypes &  support Accept-Language
items.body:
I need to access mediaTypes in my project, so expose it through a struct (MediaType).
I also noticed that the implementation of AcceptLanguage  is still incomplete,  so add the parsing logic for it.

items.title: Fixing a small warning in unit tests
items.body: This call is using `try` but it does not need to.

items.title: Added missing JSON content-type to validation middleware Response
items.body: The ValidationMiddleware's response was missing the JSON content type in the headers, as seen on other middleware response (Abort for example).

items.title: Fix for #726
items.body: This PR depends on https://github.com/vapor/json/pull/19

items.title: Fix: Process should exit if no servers are started after `run`
items.body:
In the blocking version, the process would live as long as a server
loop was running. Since the non-blocking version doesn’t use loops, a
`DispatchQueue` was used to keep the process alive when a `run` command
was issued. However, some `run` commands don’t start servers and are
expected to exit. This patch fixes that.

Fixes https://github.com/vapor/vapor/issues/735

items.title: Workaround for Swift SR-3081
items.body:
This prevents the error message “duplicate symbol __TMRbBp”, which is caused by the following Swift compiler bug: https://bugs.swift.org/browse/SR-3081

Fixes https://github.com/vapor/vapor/issues/732

items.title: Fixes Qutheory.io anchor in PROJECTS.md
items.body: Just a small fix for redirecting to Qutheory.io section

items.title: access request from view
items.body:
This pull request adds access to the `Request` (including sessions, storage, and more) from views. ### Access Request from View ```swift drop.get("view") { req in return try drop.view.make("form", [ "name": "Foo" ], for: request) } ``` ```leaf

My Form: #(name)

#if(request.session.data.user) { Welcome #(request.session.data.user.name) } ```

items.title: Cors
items.body: Closing #731

items.title: Added LoginRedirectMiddleware
items.body:
Works just like the protect middleware, except if users are unauthenticated this automatically redirects to the login page instead of throwing an error. 

I've found this middleware to be very useful for my servers. Makes it really easy to set up routes that users need to be authenticated for, but send them to the login page automatically instead of making the user manually enter the login page url.

Could probably be renamed to just "RedirectMiddleware" though

items.title: Add in logger in non-deprecated init()
items.body: This change allows users of the non-deprecated init() of Droplet to pass in an optional logger.  This will allow development of loggers that capture ALL logged output, including items that occur during the initialization of the logger.  Currently, all logs currently always go to the ConsoleLogger during initialization and only after this can the logger be replaced for subsequent logging.

items.title: Added a catch all in the AbortMiddleware to always return json or html
Better error handling of CORSConfiguration init from config json
multipart improvements
items.body:
This PR adds a new package called [Multipart](https://github.com/vapor/multipart) which contains two modules:
- `Multipart`
- `FormData`

This new package adds the following functionality:
- Fixes #761.
- `multipart/form-data` parsing speed has been improved by ~6x. 
- `multipart/form-data` serialization.
- Pure `multipart/mixed` parsing and serializing.

The new functionality has been added under `request.formData` while `request.multipart` remains functional with added deprecations.

The multipart parser was rebuilt from the ground up to be:
- Streamable
- Non-blocking
- Completely `Byte`s (no strings)
- Minmal array copies

### Benchmark

Upload of a 250MB file on release build.

![screen shot 2017-01-13 at 8 58 53 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1342803/21951352/1c37af08-d9d3-11e6-987e-be8794cf7753.png)


#### Old

![screen shot 2017-01-13 at 8 48 13 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1342803/21951295/7d0f50b6-d9d2-11e6-90ec-98ef9af70ea5.png)
![screen shot 2017-01-13 at 8 54 48 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1342803/21951300/8917a62e-d9d2-11e6-9c7d-19db9f46e716.png)

#### New

![screen shot 2017-01-13 at 8 49 44 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1342803/21951303/8f01620a-d9d2-11e6-8e91-394bebd328ba.png)
![screen shot 2017-01-13 at 8 55 07 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1342803/21951305/9418f17c-d9d2-11e6-9862-2e20904ffdfa.png)

items.title: Revert in reversed order
items.body: When starting to use preparation for setting up foreign keys or migrations, I believe it makes sense to revert in the reversed order.
